newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Omni Industries gets nod for Singapore listing.
newsitem.headline: Omni Industries gets nod for Singapore listing.

text.p: Electronics company Omni Industries Pte Ltd said on Thursday it had received approval in principle from the Stock Exchange of Singapore for a listing on the Singapore bourse.

Omni is in product design and development, plastic injection mould fabrication and moulding and contract manufacturing of printed circuit board assemblies. It also trades and distributes electronic components and computer peripherals.
The company said in a statement it intended to use proceeds from its share offer to expand operations in China, to buy new machinery and equipment and to repay bank borrowings.
It has 10 manufacturing plants in Singapore, Malaysia and China.
Its shares would be listed on the second board, SESDAQ, it said.
In 1995, Omni recorded attributable profit of about Singapore $6.0 million on a turnover of S$140 million.
